Module com.example.inventorysystem
Package com.hubbard.inventorysystem.model

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
com.hubbard.inventorysystem.model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object

Contains all functions for managing company inventory

Author:
Lincoln Hubbard

  • Method Details

    • initNewProduct

      public static Product initNewProduct(int id, String name, int stock, double price, int min, int max, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> partsToAdd)

      Used to pass new Product object into methods when updating inventory

      Parameters:
      id - The id to set
      name - The name to set
      price - The price of product to set
      stock - The number of product in inventory to set
      min - The minimum number of product in inventory to set
      max - The maximum number of product in inventory to set
      partsToAdd - Can be empty
      Returns:
      New product to be added/updated
      See Also:

      • Params are inherited from constructor

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part newPart)

      RUNTIME_ERROR Was getting errors when trying to (Cast) to the correct Part subclass, fixed by implementing a bIsOutsourced boolean variable in the AddPartController and ModifyPartController classes

      Parameters:
      newPart - The part to be added into inventory

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product newProduct)
      Parameters:
      newProduct - The product to be added into inventory
      See Also:

      • Use first to return Product object to pass into *this* method

    • lookUpPart

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookUpPart(String partQuery)
      Parameters:
      partQuery - Part ID or name to search inventory for
      Returns:
      An array of matching parts (ID or Name only)
      See Also:

      • Use this method if Part object needs to be returned

    • lookUpPart

      public static Part lookUpPart(int idQuery)
      Parameters:
      idQuery - Part ID for part to be returned
      Returns:
      A part object matching ID
      See Also:

      • Use this method if populating tables with search bar

    • lookUpProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookUpProduct(String productQuery)
      Parameters:
      productQuery - Product ID or name to search inventory for
      Returns:
      An array of matching products (ID or Name only)
      See Also:

      • Use this method if Product object needs to be returned

    • lookUpProduct

      public static Product lookUpProduct(int idQuery)
      Parameters:
      idQuery - Product ID for part to be returned
      Returns:
      A product object matching ID
      See Also:

      • Use this method if populating tables with search bar

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int index, Part selectedPart)

      RUNTIME_ERROR Had issues updating part values until I found the set() method in the JavaFX 8 API documentation

      Parameters:
      index - The index of the part to update
      selectedPart - Used to pass in values to update part with
      See Also:

      • Uses this method to update values

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct(int index, Product selectedProduct)
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the product to update
      selectedProduct - Used to pass in values to update product with
      See Also:

      • Uses this method to update values

      Parameters:
      selectedPart - The part to remove from inventory
      Returns:
      If deletion was successful
